tit.e: Sacchodo (a generic name of Satsuma Domain, Choshu Domain, and Tosa Domain)
Sacchodo (a generic name of Satsuma Domain, Choshu Domain, and Tosa Domain)
Sacchodo (a generic name of Satsuma Domain, Choshu Domain, and Tosa Domain)

sen.j: 薩長土（さっちょうど）は、幕末期、「雄藩」と呼ばれ、多くの志士を輩出し、明治維新の原動力となった薩摩藩、長州藩、土佐藩の「勤皇三藩」の総称、あるいは、この3藩出身の志士たちの総称。
sen.e: Sacchodo was called 'Yuhan (powerfull domain)' in the end of Edo period, and produced many patriotic samurais, and a generic name of 'Royal three Domains', Satsuma Domain, Choshu Domain, and Tosa Domain which were the motive power of he Meiji Restoration, or a generic name of the patriotic Samurais from these three Domains.

Sacchodo was called 'Yuhan (powerfull domain)' in the end of Edo period, and produced many patriotic samurais, and a generic name of 'Royal three Domains', Satsuma Domain, Choshu Domain, and Tosa Domain which were the of he Meiji Restoration, or a generic name of the patriotic Samurais from these three Domains.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: Sacchodo was called 'Yuhan' (powerfull domain) in the end of Edo period, and produced many patriotic samurais, and a generic name of 'Royal three Domains,' Satsuma Domain, Choshu Domain, and Tosa Domain which were the of the Meiji Restoration, or a generic name of the patriotic Samurais from these three Domains.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整カンマの位置を調整スペース調整スペルミス修正: he → the

sen.j: 戊辰戦争の頃から肥前藩を加え、「薩長土肥」と呼ばれる明治の主要政治勢力の母体となった。
sen.e: It was added the Hizen Domain around the Boshin War and became a parent organization of main political force in Meiji which was called 'Saccho Dohi (Satsuma, Choshu, Tosa, Hizen)'.
Around the time of the Boshin War, Sacchodo and the Hizen Domain were combined and called, "Saccho Dohi (Satsuma, Choshu, Tosa, Hizen)", and was one of the main political forces dring the Meiji Era.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味をより分かりやすくために訳文を変えました。
sen.e: Around the time of the Boshin War, Sacchodo and the Hizen Domain were combined and called, 'Saccho Dohi' (Satsuma, Choshu, Tosa, Hizen), and was one of the main political forces during the Meiji Era.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション調整スペルミス修正: dring → during
